documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform currently does not support indefinite carry-over of unused air ticket balances. Users cannot automatically transfer unused ticket allowances between policy years, which limits flexibility in time-off management.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Customers must manually calculate total requests across multi-year cycles (e.g., 5 requests/year × 5 years = 25 total requests). No automatic carry-over of unused balances between years means careful upfront planning is required.
documentation_candidates.workaround: For multi-year policies, calculate total requests needed across entire cycle and set that as the total number of requests. For example, if 5 requests per year are needed over a 5-year renewal cycle, set total requests to 25. Unused requests do not carry forward to the next cycle.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Air Ticket Policy Configuration — Multi-Year Cycles and Request Allocation

documentation_candidates.summary: Air tickets - Booked tickets notification (tagging LM when not in approval flow OR workflow on ticket requests)
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform currently cannot notify or tag line managers about ticket processing when they are outside the standard approval flow. There is no automated notification system for proxy requesters or managers raising requests for employees.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Line managers who submit air ticket requests on behalf of blue collar employees cannot receive notifications when tickets are booked or processed. They must manually check system status or rely on email communication, creating visibility gaps.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Ensure line managers are included in the air ticket approval flow if notification tracking is required. Alternatively, use email or manual communication channels to inform line managers of ticket processing status.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Air Ticket Request Notifications — Tracking Status for Line Managers

documentation_candidates.summary: As an employee I want to manage my air ticket requests from my air tickets
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The platform currently lacks a unified interface for employees to manage air ticket requests under various policy conditions. There are specific scenarios where employees cannot fully interact with or understand their air ticket encashment status.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Employees cannot manage air ticket requests when: auto-encashment policy is inactive, hire date or probation end date is missing, they are added to policy but not yet eligible, or they are awaiting next encashment cycle. This creates confusion about eligibility and timing.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Ensure employee records are complete with hire date and probation end date before assigning to auto-encashment policies. Verify policy is active and employee meets eligibility criteria before attempting to manage air ticket requests.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Air Ticket Auto-Encashment — Policy Requirements and Eligibility

documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The current Expense Manager role lacks granular permission controls to limit data visibility. The platform does not provide configurable options to restrict cross-module access or segment viewable financial information by category.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Users with Expense Manager role can view all employee loans and air tickets, not just work expenses. This creates potential data privacy concerns and does not align with principle of least privilege for financial data access.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Currently no granular permission controls exist. Organizations must accept that Expense Managers have broad financial data visibility or implement external access controls and audit procedures.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Role-Based Access Control — Expense Manager Permissions and Data Visibility

documentation_candidates.summary: Letter requests - upload the document after stamping
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat platform does not support a flexible document approval workflow that allows post-approval modifications, attachment uploads, or status reversions for letter requests.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Organizations cannot implement external document signing workflows where letters are downloaded, physically stamped/attested, and re-uploaded. Approved requests cannot be modified or have attachments added, and cannot be returned to pending status.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Current workaround: (1) Keep request in pending status, (2) Upload signed document as attachment while pending, (3) Then approve request. However, this requires careful workflow planning and does not support the full external signing process.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Letter Request Workflow — External Stamping and Document Re-Upload Limitations

documentation_candidates.summary: Restricted People manager role - can still see other employees (out of assigned group)
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform currently lacks full role-based group restrictions, with grouping functionality limited to finance and payroll modules. People Manager and Adjustment Manager roles can view and edit employees outside their assigned groups across HR and document modules.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Employee grouping restrictions only apply to finance, payroll, and air ticket expense modules. People Manager and Adjustment Manager roles can still view and edit employee details, documents, and departments across all groups, limiting organizational control.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Employee grouping currently only restricts air ticket expense visibility for People Manager role. For comprehensive role-based access control across HR modules, implement external access controls or audit procedures.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Employee Groups and Role Restrictions — Supported Modules and Limitations

excluded.summary: Limited access for employees to view other users
excluded.reason: Ticket documents a feature on product roadmap (Employee Grouping and Structures) that is partially implemented for some modules but not yet available for HR modules. While this has documentation value, the ticket itself is closed and the feature is in active development. The classification is ambiguous because the feature partially exists and is being worked on. Recommend monitoring for completion and documenting when feature becomes generally available.

excluded.summary: Need to delete the test air tickets processed
excluded.reason: Ticket documents that processed air tickets cannot be deleted through any UI mechanism - this is a backend system limitation with no user-facing workaround or configuration option. While this is a feature gap, it is a purely technical backend constraint with no testable UI behavior and limited documentation value beyond stating 'processed air tickets cannot be deleted.' The limitation is obvious from system behavior and does not require user guide explanation.
